tweet: Finally, we held a hearing on paid family & medical leave. We discussed how the US is the only industrialized nation that does not guarantee access to it.  American workers have been outspoken about the importance of this.  We heard them loud and clear. And we must act. pic.twitter.com/OBaYnd8kVk

>700 women in America die of pregnancy-related deaths each yr & experts view us as one of the most dangerous places in the industrialized world to give birth. Congress can make change in maternity care, eradicate these disparities, lower the maternal mortality rate & save lives. pic.twitter.com/09jcn7EVMM
The topic of racial disparities and social determinants in the maternal mortality crisis were addressed in another hearing with Olympian @AllysonFelix.

We also held a hearing on the economic and health consequences of #climatechange with @DrKateMarvel - another topic that hadn't been touched by the committee in 12 years. Climate change is real. Climate change is harmful. And it is time for Congress to get on board. pic.twitter.com/Ad6un5aYvD

We held a hearing on #infrastructure - the first in 8 years. The deficiencies of our roads, bridges, transit, water systems, broadband & electrical grids are well-documented & widely known and are a problematic reality for every single congressional district in the nation. pic.twitter.com/LWwGO85aBo
Since January, @WaysMeansCmte has held countless hearings – some on topics that haven’t ever been discussed and others that haven’t been talked about in years. pic.twitter.com/bgglqXFCNs

The #SECUREAct goes a long way in addressing this problem by making it easier for Americans to save. Passage of this bill was a tremendous bipartisan accomplishment, and I hope to see the measure move through Congress and be signed into law in short order. pic.twitter.com/J6taAV5Exa

One of my top priorities in @WaysMeansCmte is to help workers of all ages prepare for a secure #retirement. We currently face a retirement income crisis, with too many people in danger of not having enough savings to maintain their standard of living & avoid sliding into poverty. pic.twitter.com/0XuXsmTAYC

In May the House passed #SECUREAct 417-3 after it soared through @WaysandMeansCmte. This legislation expands opportunities for Americans to increase their retirement savings & improves the portability of lifetime income options from one plan to another.  https://bit.ly/2L264qB

Our nation continues to have some of the best #healthcare in the world – but many families remain concerned about their ability to access and afford that care. We’re working to change that. pic.twitter.com/qTVk42KXTI

Our “Pathways to Universal Health Coverage” hearing was part of @WaysMeansCmte effort to build on the progress we’ve made and explore opportunities to achieve affordable universal coverage. pic.twitter.com/ZPdWfX0Jm0

We held hearings on drug pricing & unanimously passed the bipartisan Prescription Drug STAR Act. This addresses issues related to transparency & public reporting of information in order to improve accountability and ensure all parties have a better understanding of this market. pic.twitter.com/uVjZs7Blp7
We kicked off the Congress with a hearing on #preexisting conditions, where there was bipartisan consensus that we need to protect these Americans. pic.twitter.com/PDf4zTwa5y

As Chairman of @WaysMeansCmte, I helped draw attention to issues in the first half of this year that are of critical importance to constituents, especially in the #healthcare field. pic.twitter.com/JvGR6TYzrX

In addition, we were able to expand the Earned Income Tax Credit #EITC to single filers and passed legislation to increase the Child Tax Credit #CTC & the Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit #CDCTC. All of these initiatives are good for families and good for our economy. pic.twitter.com/Nlc48FpXwR

We passed a much-needed fix to reverse unfair & unexpected high taxes on #GoldStar families, low-income scholarship recipients & children of fallen first responders. We owe these families our deepest gratitude & I'm glad the House was able to provide them w/ relief they deserve. pic.twitter.com/sLOVLWEUzu

The #PRIDEAct of 2019 allows married same-sex couples to file claims for credits & refunds related to a change in their marital status back to their year of marriage. It also amends the tax code so that provisions that apply to married couples use gender-neutral language. pic.twitter.com/zJmhnsCUbx
Today we are highlighting tax legislation that was passed through @WaysMeansCmte and has since passed the House. pic.twitter.com/Hb1L09EryH
I am proud to serve alongside so many great women in Congress. #WomensEqualityDay https://twitter.com/SpeakerPelosi/status/1166027108918931456 …

At the end of July, the House passed this bipartisan piece of legislation to protect these hardworking Americans. It’s time for the Senate to step up and do what’s right for men and women who played by the rules their whole careers, who deserve to receive the savings they earned. pic.twitter.com/5Loz7TaaLP

Now, after working for decades, their planned retirements may be taken away from them through no fault of their own.  And taken away at a time when they no longer have time to prepare for retirement because they’re now in retirement. pic.twitter.com/eHHXnmMXo6

Today, we look at the passage of the #ButchLewisAct that  addresses the nation’s multiemployer pension crisis affecting nearly 1.3M people. These are workers who planned for their retirement & year after year chose to contribute to their pensions instead of taking a wage increase pic.twitter.com/uIhHxAYqB8
This week I am highlighting some great achievements that we were able to accomplish in the first seven months since I was named Chair of the @WaysMeansCmte. pic.twitter.com/4TdjLiyFLF

The deficiencies of our roads, bridges, transit, water systems, broadband connectivity and electrical grids are well-documented and widely known. This is a problematic reality for every single state and congressional district in the nation. We must continue to act on this issue. https://twitter.com/WaysMeansCmte/status/1164906854482370566 …

I am proud to have led the fight against the elimination of historic tax credits in the #GOPTaxLaw b/c they transform buildings like these #intheberkshires and breathe new life into them for years to come. Thanks to @SecretaryofMass @repsmitty & @adamghinds for their partnership. https://twitter.com/BerkshireEagle/status/1164175595305086976 …

Did you know #MountGreylock (standing at 3,491 feet) is the highest point in Massachusetts? If you look closely at this picture taken on a recent visit to Crum Hill in #Monroe, Mount Greylock can be seen on the far left. An amazing natural treasure in #CD1. pic.twitter.com/K8jc3XIsSI

Keeping families together is important whether it's aging parents or adult children living with disabilities. On the @WaysMeansCmte, we are committed to continuing to fight for these families each and every day.

CMS reported this week that Massachusetts is among 10 states that made the greatest progress in increasing #Medicaid spending on community-based long-term services & supports. This means more families can support loved ones in the community, rather than turning to an institution.
Social Security has been working for the people for 83 years. Let’s protect it, expand it and defend it. #SocSec84 pic.twitter.com/Nfm3Y7ogC6

This is why the #SECUREAct is so important. It expands opportunities for Americans to increase their #retirement savings and improves the portability of lifetime income options from one plan to another. https://twitter.com/WaysMeansCmte/status/1160957537254092807 …

Yesterday I celebrated #NationalHealthCenterWeek at @HolyokeHealth with the awarding of a @HHSGov grant that will aid in the staffing and construction of their new Community Health Programs Department focused on treating #opioid use disorder. https://twitter.com/WWLP22News/status/1159654786599440384 …

Millions of Americans live with a pre-existing condition – including almost 3 million right here in MA. Thanks to ACA, they’re protected from discrimination – but that will go away if Republicans win their anti-health care lawsuit. #ProtectOurCare pic.twitter.com/tnqa8ze68N

Proud to join @RepThompson and over 200 of my colleagues to demand that two bills the House passed in February to prevent gun violence are taken to the floor of the Senate for a vote immediately. We must act. https://twitter.com/RepThompson/status/1159169224125890560 …

I have led the charge in Congress to extend the wind and solar tax credits because they are part of the solution to ensuring a clean and safe environment for generations to come. Thanks to @AvangridRen for having me to their sites in Florida and Monroe. pic.twitter.com/8uJCkHp4Ua

I have been diligent in my role as Chairman of @WaysMeansCmte to ensure that there are more federal dollars spent on #opioid addiction treatment. I was happy to celebrate this great success story with Hampden Co. Sheriff Nick Cocchi yesterday https://bit.ly/2yLbD5y

I have put forward ten common sense proposals to prevent future mass shootings.

It is time for Congress and President Trump to act on them.

The scourge of gun violence continues in this country unabated with nearly 40 innocent people killed in deadly attacks in Texas and Ohio this weekend.

While we grieve for those who lost loved ones, thoughts & prayers are not enough.
